intro: Rhexia uncata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bearded bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes carnivorous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it typically grows in wet, acidic habitats such as marshes and bogs. Rhexia uncata has slender, hairy stems and narrow leaves, and it often forms dense colonies in its wetland environment. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
